item.title: Configure Ssh Alias
item.description: Tutorial to connect your server with ssh alias ssh-keygen Create an ssh private/public keypair I named my key personal For passwordless experience, you could let passphrase empty. cd $HOME/.ssh ssh-keygen -t rsa Copy public key to server My server is 192.168.1.111. Do replace with yours. 2.1. Manually copy 2.2. Use ssh-copy-id Copy the public key to server ssh-copy-id -i personal root@192.168.1.111 Try login by password ssh 'root@192.168.1.111' Chmod server’s ssh files permission for security
